climbs.name: Winter Is Coming
climbs.fa: Alex A., Julie Doyle, Jim Yarnold

content.description:
Climb a black water streak. The crux is low near the 2nd bolt. Watch out not to Z clip, as the bolts are close. Staying in the black streak is more interesting climbing (

vs.

climbing left of the bolts). There are a few top rope variations to the left, once every so often, in winter, this forms a frozen waterfall
content.protection: 7 lead bolts and a 2 bolt top anchor.

content.description: Climb the dihedral with a crack to a small overhang to a face with one bolt.
content.protection: A trad rack to a #3 cam, one bolt, and 2 top bolt anchors.

content.description: Climb the dihedral (which is the easy way) or climb the face (a little harder) to a steeper face. Staying left of the bolts is a little harder.
content.protection: 6 lead bolts and a 2 bolt top anchor.
content.location: It is the 2nd route from the left.

content.description:
Start right of a large boulder. There are two climbs that follow the same bolt line. Staying left of the bolts is

Viserion

. Climb up and left behind the boulder. Avoid stepping on or using good holds. The crux is 3rd bolt.

Khaleesi

climbs the face to the right of these bolts.
content.protection: 7 lead bolts and a 2 bolt top anchor.
content.location: Start just right of a large boulder.

content.description:
Climb crack on the right of large boulder. The crux is the start. At the top, it's a little runout but easy. This uses the anchors on

Khaleesi

.

If you would like to have some more adventure, you can turn these into longer routes by climbing the upper cracks. There are a few to choose from that go the summit. You will have to walk off the top.
content.protection: A rack to a #3 cam or toprope off the sport anchors to the left of the crack.
content.location:
It ascends the crack right of

Khaleesi

.

content.description:
This is a bouldering traverse that starts just right of the

Night King

and traverses to the left at the base of the wall until you come tree. Then traverse back.

climbs.name: Ironborn (TR variation to Night King)
climbs.fa: Alex A., Jim Yarnold, Julie Doyle

content.description:
This is a toprope left of

Night King

that follows the crack to a dihedral then over the bulge.

Helmets are not bad idea, as there may a little choss near the top.

Khaleesi is a variation, share the same bolts climb the face mostly to the right of the bolts with fun face climbing with some small holds. There is toprope 5.9 to the right. Follow a short crack system to the face, left of the wider crack.
content.protection: 7 lead bolts and a 2 bolt top anchor.
content.location: It is the last bolted line on the wall.

climbs.name: Night King
climbs.fa: Alex A., Jim Yarnold, Julie Doyle

content.description: There are two routes here. One is using everything. Start below a large flake, and wander up climbing the face and arête. The 2nd one is 5.9+/10a and avoids the flake staying more on the face then going up the arête.
content.protection: 7 lead bolts and a 2 bolt top anchor.

climbs.name: Dragonglass
climbs.fa: Alex A., Jim Yarnold, Julie Doyle

content.description: Choose wisely as to which way to go. The wrong way is a little trickier (harder).
content.protection: 7 lead bolts and a 2 bolt top anchor.
content.location: It is the 4th route from the left.
